# Arpeggio: add2 in C# (Shape: C) 

## Brief Presentation
This arpeggio is a C# add2 arpeggio, played in C shape on the guitar. It includes the notes C# (root), E# (major 3rd), F# (perfect 4th), and G# (add2).

## Notes and Intervals
- C#: Root
- E#: Major 3rd
- F#: Perfect 4th
- G#: Add2

## Genre and Musical Flavor
This arpeggio is commonly found in various genres such as rock, metal, jazz, and even pop. It adds a dreamy and ethereal sound to the music due to the inclusion of the add2 note. It can be used to create tension and resolution in compositions or improvisations.

## 3 Songs
1. "Little Wing" by Jimi Hendrix - This iconic song features arpeggios with dreamy qualities, making use of similar arpeggio shapes found in this C# add2 arpeggio.
2. "Scar Tissue" by Red Hot Chili Peppers - The intro guitar riff of this song utilizes arpeggios with a similar flavor to the C# add2 arpeggio, creating a mellow and introspective atmosphere.
3. "Autumn Leaves" (Jazz Standard) - Jazz musicians often use arpeggios with added tones to create colorful harmonies. This arpeggio shape can be heard in various jazz standards, adding sophistication to improvisations.
